issue.title: how to write the code to drive the boat go ahead?

content.raw:
Is there existing sample code your are interested in - or are you asking for a new example?  All of the existing code is open-source and available.  We’d be happy to help you find examples from the existing source.

I’ve added a short section of the current [driving tutorial](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/Driving) to provide some details of interface options to publish to the ROS network.  If you are new to ROS I would recommend using your tool of choice \(C\+\+?\) and starting with the tutorials mentioned to publish the messages on the ROS topics: `/wamv/thrusters/left_thrust_cmd` and `/wamv/thrusters/right_thrust_cmd`

I hope that is helpful.
content.html:
Is there existing sample code your are interested in - or are you asking for a new example? All of the existing code is open-source and available. We’d be happy to help you find examples from the existing source.

I’ve added a short section of the current driving tutorial to provide some details of interface options to publish to the ROS network. If you are new to ROS I would recommend using your tool of choice (C++?) and starting with the tutorials mentioned to publish the messages on the ROS topics: /wamv/thrusters/left_thrust_cmd and /wamv/thrusters/right_thrust_cmd

I hope that is helpful.
